newsitem.title: BRAZIL: No frost seen in Brazil coffee belt - Somar.
newsitem.headline: No frost seen in Brazil coffee belt - Somar.

text.p: A cold front is forecast to enter Brazil's coffee producing areas this week but cloud cover will prevent frosts in the coffee belt, independent meteorologist Somar said.
"The cloudy skies will prevent the formation of frost in the coffee areas and minimum temperatures are forecast at between eight and 10 degrees Celsius," Somar said in a regular bulletin.

The cold air mass linked to the front will affect Argentina, Uruguay and the south of Brazil from Aug 5. Temperatures were seen dropping to freezing point in southern Parana, Santa Catarina and Rio Grande do Sul with dawn frosts.
But the north of Parana was expected to remain very cloudy due to low pressure systems.
Somar said a cold front had brought clouds and rain to Sao Paulo and northern Parana over the weekend.

Temperatures were forecast to remain stable in northern Parana, where they hit 16 degrees C overnight. In the Pocos de Caldas region of southern Minas Gerais, the minimum temperature was seven degrees C.

The cold front expected this week was seen changing the atmospheric pattern and bringing back typical winter days to the center-south. Somar will be closely monitoring the evolution of polar air masses over the South Pacific during this period.
